metadata.title: CVE-2020-36558 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A race condition in the Linux kernel before 5.5.7 involving VT_RESIZEXcould lead to a NULL pointer dereference and general protection fault.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36558` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-178.208
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-178.208
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-178.208
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-99.100~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-99.100~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-99.100~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1070.77
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1106.117
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1066.70~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1082.92~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1061.65
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1038.42~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-178.208').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-99.100~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1070.77').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1106.117').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1066.70~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1082.92~16.04.1').
linux-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1061.65').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1038.42~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
